meanings.definition: A short introductory section in a book, typically written by someone other than the author.
meanings.sent1: The foreword of the story explained the background of the characters.
meanings.sent2: I always read the foreword before diving into a new book.
meanings.sent3: The foreword was so interesting that it made me want to read the whole book.
meanings.sent4: Her foreword was like a welcoming handshake to the readers.
meanings.sent5: The foreword set the stage for the adventure that followed.

meanings.definition: To write a foreword for a book.
meanings.sent1: She was asked to foreword the upcoming novel by the famous author.
meanings.sent2: I need to foreword this manuscript before it goes to print.
meanings.sent3: He decided to foreword the book as a gesture of appreciation.
meanings.sent4: Forewording a book requires understanding the author's style and message.
meanings.sent5: The author carefully foreworded the novel to engage the readers from the start.
